column1: Request Cloud-Ops for new EC2 & S3 Instances
column31:
Request:
 -2 new EC2 instances in Dev-
 4 new EC2 instances in Stage (using existing EC2 instances to model after) with new Task Definition that will point to new image

Stage should be as closely similar to Prod as possible. FW needs to be set for existing connections and also new Postgres connection. (see CLOUDSD-1838 as an example)

New S3 buckets (using existing S3 to model after)
column334:
17/Jun/22 7:03 PM;cmiller;[~ZEKI001]-

As noted in a separate email, we should be able to proceed with getting these instances provisioned.

Thanks,
-Craig
;;;
column335:
17/Jun/22 7:04 PM;cmiller;Added the latest diagram, but note that this will need another change that was noted in the recent email:

* The PG-MIG database environment will be solely for use by the AWS/L&T AWS/L&T Postgres Migration team and we will NOT need a Tx Mgr development cluster linked to it. Instead, we should plan on doing the small amount of development work we need to do (DB connections, modifications of error handling, dictionary load changes) directly in environment linked to PG-TEST.

Will update the diagram whenever a new one is published.
;;;
column337:
21/Jun/22 4:11 PM;cmiller;[~ZEKI001]-

Yes, that's correct.
The cluster depicted on the left hand side with PG_MIG will not be required.

Thanks,
-Craig
;;;

https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/CLOUDOPS-10815 ;;;
column339:
30/Nov/22 1:42 PM;zeki001;Hello [~DONO002]  and [~cmiller],

Now, we have two new up-and-running environments, and I'm going to close this ticket. If something comes up I will create a support ticket for CloudOps.

We need to make some additional code adaptations - regarding the using PG driver and handling PG concurrency issues, but on that part, we will work using separate tickets. 

Thanks,
Alem;;;

column1: AOMA3: User managed email subscriptions
column31:
Hi Brittney,
Please add the following enhancements:

1)	Export: Add exported by user name and email address to email notifications (add the below image for example)
2)	AOMA3: User managed email subscriptions
3)	Unifying email notifications

First one can be done early next year. 

Thanks,
Rohit 

From: Catandella, Michael, Sony Music 
Sent: Tuesday, December 13, 2016 9:42 AM

Hey Rohit/Ralph, 

Could we get the sender added to these notifications? 

Also, I’m wondering if we should have an audit of all e-mail notifications and message configurations scheduled for some time in our future.  It seems like there are multiple export notification types and they appear to differ in ways that could probably be made more uniform? 
What do you think? 

Maybe try to clean up the logic around notifications.  I think it would even be cool for future to allow users to manage their own notifications through a user preference or profile in AOMA3. 

Thanks,

Michael Catandella
column334:
16/Mar/20 7:50 PM;frie010;Per [~SHAR051]:

One way to do this would be to create a new permission so that a user can see/edit their own system notification user settings (vs. an admin who an edit anyone's user settings).;;;
column335: 22/Jun/20 8:18 PM;frie010;This will be covered by AOMA-16051;;;

column1: DB BACKFILL: AOMA DSD Asset metadata (sample_rate) in AOMA using MediaInfo tool Descriptor Conversion.
column31: A story for AOMA to backfill the metadata of all DSD assets using MediaInfo tool which were previously registered with the FFMpeg tool.
column334: 04/Jun/20 9:20 PM;sdonipu;This story originated from the 06/04/2020 conversion meeting and will be assigned to the AOMA team *ONLY* after Conversion side changes are completed and ready for AOMA to proceed with Backfill in DEV, STAGE and PROD.;;;
column335:
15/Jun/20 9:20 PM;gule001;Per [~shan] - this should considered a blocker for SMEJ Mora partner deliveries. 

[~shan] is asking if the values in AOMA that were registered can be overriden via a mass database update. ;;;
column336:
26/Jun/20 6:18 PM;sdonipu;[~aomacoredev] [~roraj01] - Please check on the above query from Sang above regarding the DSD Sampling Rate backfill.

On a side note, the below 
 # New CT is {color:#de350b}CTID 2600{color} is shared on https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/AOMA2-226.
 # Sample MediaInfoDescriptor XML for DSD28 is shared on https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/AOMA2-226.
 # MediaInfoDescriptor.XSD is also shared on https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/AOMA2-226

Thanks,
 Sharada;;;
column337: 30/Jun/20 6:25 PM;rich014;[~bsahoo1], [~SAMA030] : Brajesh/Ralph, Please provide an estimate for when you believe this will be completed.  It is required for a release we need to implement soon.  Thank you, Reid;;;
column338:
06/Jul/20 2:57 PM;sdonipu;[~bsahoo1] - To fix compilation errors (reported in AOMA2-226) you will need to add JAXB binding file. For the bit-depth issue, the DSD file doesn't have a bit-depth when I view it in the MediaInfo tool, so you are not able to see it. To validate whether bit-depth was read from the DSD file previously, Can you please attach a sample descriptor file generated by current/old *CTID 1066* which uses the FFMpeg tool? 

The issue reported for DSD assets by SCOPs (ACS-1096) was for the discrepant data found for the SAMPLE_RATE metadata on the DSD file versus the value of sample_rate delivered in the partner XML files by Delivery. So in order to fix the discrepancy, the AOMA-Core system needs to use new CT 2600  and parse the Descriptor files generated by the MediaInfo tool which is driven by the new *CTID 2600* and backfill all of the registered DSD assets with the accurate SAMPLE_RATE value. That way, when Delivery reads the metadata of a DSD file from the AOMA asset management tool, they read the correct sample_rate and put it in their partner XML files.

Let me know if any further doubts/questions.

Thanks,
Sharada

 ;;;
column339: 06/Jul/20 3:02 PM;bsahoo1;[~sdonipu] Please see attached sample DSD descriptor.xml  [^000005017494_001_001.dsf.descriptor.xml] ;;;
column340:
06/Jul/20 3:19 PM;sdonipu;Thanks. Also, I am getting below error with an empty CT list while trying to look up CTID 1066 and CT2600 in Media File Converter in AOMA-Dev. Can you check once and let me know if there is an issue? 

!image-2020-07-06-09-19-35-073.png!;;;
column341:
06/Jul/20 3:48 PM;sdonipu;The attached descriptor XML (000005017494_001_001.dsf.descriptor) shows 0 for bit-depth. So looks like there was no bit-depth info available for DSD files even previously in the past. You will have to check on your end how currently AOMA system and wherefrom it gets bit-depth for DSD files and persists to AOMA DB. The media Conversion system is not providing a bit-depth for DSD Descriptors because neither FFMpeg nor MediaInfo tools were able to extract it from the DSD file as DSD file

 

Please note, BIT_DEPTH and SAMPLE_RATE both metadata are different and serve a different purpose. Please check with [~roraj01] which all values need to be backfilled along with SAMPLE_RATE using the new CTID 2600 and make decisions accordingly. 

 

{color:#172b4d}In both of the below XML outputs, there is no BIT_DEPTH with a valid value. Can you please check where is AOMA reading/persisting bit_depth as 1 for the current and registered ~3000 DSD assets in production?{color}

 

*FFMpeg Descriptor XML Output:*
{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<wav
    xmlns="http://xml.common.asset.aoma.sonymusic.com/WavDescriptor.xsd">
    <wavAttributes>
        <wavAttribute value="20475" name="Duration"/>
        <wavAttribute value="352800" name="Sample Rate"/>
        <wavAttribute value="0" name="Bit Depth"/>
        <wavAttribute value="2" name="Number Of Channels"/>
    </wavAttributes>
</wav>
{code}

{code:xml}

column342: 06/Jul/20 3:49 PM;bsahoo1;Yes [~sdonipu]. I'm looking into it. I will update once this is resolved.;;;
column343: 06/Jul/20 9:27 PM;sdonipu;Thanks [~bsahoo1]. Let us know once the MFC issue is fixed. We can run some test conversions for DSD new CTID 2600. Also, please let us know how and from where BIT_DEPTH for DSD assets is currently read? Is it hard-coded to 1 as default on the AOMA side anywhere? ;;;
column345: 07/Jul/20 3:04 PM;rich014;[~bsahoo1] : Brajesh, is this task ready for Sharada now?  If possible, please provide a status before 10AM so we can discuss in our stand up.  Release is scheduled for next Monday and we must assess the practicality of getting through the testing processes in time.  Thank you.;;;
column346:
07/Jul/20 3:35 PM;sdonipu;Hi [~bsahoo1] - Please let us know when will you be able to submit some DSD registrations/conversions for CTID 2600. We will check on our end. This integration is planned for conversion upcoming build on 13th July 2020. 

Regarding MFC, I will try to run some test conversions for CT2600 and let you know. This testing should not block your work. 

Please let us know if you have passed through the JAXB binding issue or you need any help from us on that. 

Thanks,
Sharada;;;
column347: 07/Jul/20 3:35 PM;bsahoo1;[~RICH014], This is not ready yet. I'm working on it. Please review above comments and the sample descriptor.xml and let me know.;;;
column348:
07/Jul/20 3:42 PM;sdonipu;[~bsahoo1] - Regarding bit_depth open question, I have already answered above. Please check my comments from 06/Jul/2020 at 9:48 AM.

https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/AOMA-16033?focusedCommentId=2964766&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-2964766

 

Also, you confirmed that bit_depth on the AOMA side is being hard-coded to 1 for DSD assets from the beginning of its implementation. Hope this will clarify your open question/doubt on BIT_DEPTH for DSD assets.

Let us know.  

!image-2020-07-07-09-50-47-696.png!;;;
column349: 07/Jul/20 4:03 PM;bsahoo1;[~sdonipu], The hard coded value is only for display purpose i.e. in DSD Product Details page. We are not persisting anything hard coded to DB. The value which is read from the xsd is being persisted to DB.;;;

07/Jul/20 4:55 PM;sdonipu;[~bsahoo1] -

Okay. In that case, please check with the @GlobalMediaProduction team to understand what will be the BIT_DEPTH for all the 3 flavors DSD assets. because we don't see any bit depth metadata for the sample set of DSF files that [~LEMO022] shared with us initially to fix and test around the sample_rate problem.

column351: 07/Jul/20 5:05 PM;gule001;[~bsahoo1] we are going to break out the Bit depth issue to separate tickets as addressing it alongside this requirement is scope creep - it was not part of the initial requirements. Also, no one has complained about the bit depth value.  The SMEJ MORA partner only has an issue with the Sample Rate value being incorrect (DPSO-74756). ;;;
column353:
10/Jul/20 2:19 AM;bsahoo1;[~sdonipu], All,

DSD registrations are going through now in AOMA DEV using CT2600 and new MediaInfoDescriptor.xsd. Please verify and let me know if you see any issue.

Thanks,
Brajesh;;;
column355:
13/Jul/20 2:41 PM;sdonipu;Just a thought/idea/recommendation/suggestion to share :

We can also leverage this *CT2600* as a solution for generating DESCRIPTOR XMLs of other audio and video asset types as well like *AUDIO* (WAV16, WAV24, DDP, Bluray DDP, DVD DDP, Vinyl WAV16, Vinyl WAV24, etc) and *VIDEO* (ProRes, MPEG-2, LFV, etc) if we want to standardized the tool and method of extracting metadata with the same tool and move off from FFMpeg for Asset Creation (Descriptor Generation) Phase. 

That's said, the MediaInfo tool is much more verbose and efficient than FFMpeg in terms of extracting the metadata of any AUDIO and VIDEO file. Please give it a thought, discuss it with [~mish003], and let us know what you guys decide. 

I will break out this topic as well, as a separate ACS ticket so that we can address it separately in the future.

Added ACS ticket: https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/ACS-1305 to our backlog.
  
 Thanks,
 Sharada

 ;;;
column357:
17/Jul/20 10:09 PM;sdonipu;Hi [~bsahoo1], [~SAMA030],

During the e2e testing in STAGE: https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/ACS-1271 and review of the Mora DSD sample_rate fix by GMP [~jdunca1] found out that the product "G010001279180Z" in AOMA STAGE is not showing the correct sample rate in UI. Looks like a data issue on the AOMA side.

Can you please check in the backend if the "dsd_assets" table has the right values?

The sample_rate value in UI should match with that on the source DSD file.

cc: [~jdunca1]

 

!image-2020-07-17-16-09-51-330.png!

 

Thanks,
 Sharada;;;
column358:
20/Jul/20 6:05 PM;sama030;Hi [~sdonipu], [~jdunca1],

 

The temporary backfill for DSD was done using AOMA2-286 with a default value of a single-DSD to expedite the process for SMEJ as a majority of products are single-DSD (confirmed by business in weekly meetings). The backfill with real descriptors is a more involved process that will be handled by AOMA2-287 (pending internal discussion).

 

Any new registrations should have correct data as confirmed in our E2E testing.

 

Please let me know if there are any questions/concerns on this.

 

Thanks,

Ralph;;;
column359: 20/Jul/20 6:50 PM;sama030;After speaking to [~bsahoo1] I realized this is regarding the hardcoded UI value and not the database values. We have a story AOMA2-308 to fix the UI issue with our next sprint.;;;

Thank you,
Igor

column1: Fix attemptInitiatorType in AMEBA Graphql
column31:
After switching to AMEBA Graphql for creating labelcopy import attempts, all attempts are being set to attempt_initiator_type_id = 1.  This needs to be set according to where this is being called from.  Added an action needed column to indicate what needs to be changed.
||attempt_initiator_type_id||attempt_initiator_type_nm||description_tx||action needed||
|1|AOMAUI|AOMA Web UI|This should be set for any import attempt created by the AOMA UI only (priority imports triggered by users).|
|2|DAEMON|AOMA ImporterDaemon|Please change the name to CDC, as this is a change data capture coming from RDX.|
|3|REGISTRATION|AOMA Asset Registration|This should be set for any import attempt created by the registration process.|
|4|TEST|Attempt Initiated by an Application Unit Test|For unit tests.|
|5|AOMAAPI|Attempt Initiated by AOMA API|Should be for import attempts being called by systems like GRPS (for publish status), CSA, etc.  [~gvamsik]  please confirm if this is correct.|

Also, for the Kafka messages, we need to set the correct SendingSystem attribute for the messages originating from AOMA/AMEBA. We need to distinguish user-submitted messages and system-submitted messages (GRPS, CSA, etc).

From the list below, we need to choose appropriate values or ask the RDX team to introduce new values if necessary. 
{code:java}
          {
            "name": "sendingSystem",
            "type": {
              "type": "enum",
              "name": "SendingSystem",
              "namespace": "com.sonymusic.global.ds.schema.avro.constant",
              "doc": "Schema for SendingSystem Enum",
              "symbols": [
                "FILE_WATCHER",
                "DDEX_RELEASE_INGESTER",
                "GRPS",
                "RELEASE_INGESTER_MANAGER",
                "ASSET_INGESTER",
                "RDX_CHD",
                "EROS",
                "METADATA_IMPORT",
                "EOM",
                "CONVERSION",
                "DELIVERY",
                "AOMA",
                "MEDIA_CONVERSION",
                "AMEBA",
                "AMPSV"
              ]
            }
          } {code}

It seems that all messages are using the default value "RDX_CHD".

Does it make sense for you to set it when AMEBA publishes a message to Kafka? 

If we need to re-route a message or do something similar in the future, then we don't need to make a query to the DB to check the initiator system, we can do it with the information from the message header. This can correspond to the DB values. 

Thanks,

column1: GRAS Export Decom - Phase 2 - CDC
Submit Priority Import thru Kafka
column31:
This is part of Phase 2 of the GRAS Export decommissioning project.  

Currently, when a user submit a priority import via the UI, it will create a record in the import attempt table and send a jms message to the priority queue for Transaction Manager to pick up.

Since we are switching to Kafka, we need to send a kafka message instead to the priority topic.

We should have a flag to be able to send a message via jms or kafka or both, for testing or in case of rollback.

column1: Create connection to the Kafka MSK from aoma2 apps DEV
column31:
Hi team, 
We are going to connect aoma2 applications to Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK), and listen messages from Txnmgr app. 
Applications located in arvatok8s-dev-ns and ameba-dev clusters. 

As I know we need to have connection to this servers on dev:
{quote}b-1.sme-global-msk-dev.3i225f.c6.kafka.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com:9098

b-2.sme-global-msk-dev.3i225f.c6.kafka.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com:9098

b-3.sme-global-msk-dev.3i225f.c6.kafka.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com:9098
{quote}
Could you please create next for our apps: 

1. '{*}basic_auth_credentials_source{*}';
2. '{*}awsRoleArn{*}' (it should be write and read access for consuming and publishing)
3. Not sure if we can use same *group-id = TXMGR.dev*  as in tnxmgr app{*}.{*} Should we also have {*}client-Id (unique app's name){*}?
4. And I suppose FW also should opened for aoma2 apps.
5. Which *schema_registry_url* to use?
6. *basic_auth_user_info*

Thank you,
Igor

column1: Product Event History: capture link attempt modified
column31:
Problem: The burg036 account removed the virtual master link that was created by voge036, and then re-linked the same virtual master. The UI should display the account username burg036 for these events. Instead, it displays the original username, voge036. This causes confusion on our end, as we are not getting an accurate representation of who performed these actions.


Project: we display the original creator of link attempt but we should capture another event Link Attmpt modified or so to capture the person who modified it the last.

column1: TxMgr/DigitalAssurance: Report JMS Queue size info separately
column31:
Since there is no direct mapping between RDX topics and JMS queues it no longer makes sense to combine stats from these two sources into a single item.

For example, messages from the Normal and Low priority topics are routed to a single queue - MetadataImportXML.

It makes sense to report Kafka topic lags and message queue depths as separate entities.

In addition, since the [Delivery Dashboard|https://ddb-dev-ext.smecde.com/delivery-dashboard-ui/] have instruments to mark a service as in maintenance, there is no need in our own UI and HTTP endpoints for controlling the downtime. Those can be removed to simplify the code.

!image-2025-04-17-13-10-40-696.png|width=428,height=183!

We will be moving this to Kafka and incorporating this into the DDEX Asset ingestion flow as well.  Initial discussion is that above fields are enough but we will need the new requirements for this if the above fields does not suffice.

column1: TxMgr: Enable Large Track processing only on weekends
column31: To prevent consumer and thread exhaustion during weekdays, restrict Large Track processing from the ISOLATE_PRIORITY topic to weekends only.

column1: TxMgr: Remove Isolate Priority queue; route messages to Large Track queue instead
column31:
The Isolate Priority Kafka topic will contain only messages with Large Tracks, which we should send to the Large Track message queue.

The Isolate Priority queue created specifically for this topic is no longer needed, so we should delete it.

column1: TxMgr: Pause low-priority processing when there are more than 8000 items in the queue
column31:
In the GRAS Export/TxMgr architecture, there is a feedback loop, and when the TxMgr queue has more than 8000 items, it sends a signal to GRAS Export to stop producing low-priority XMLs for a certain time. 


Accordingly, we should be able to stop consuming Kafka messages from the LOW-PRIORITY topic.

column1: TxMgr: Make TxMgr RDX Client a separate Maven artifact
column31: To make it reusable we need to make the RDX GraphQL client a separate Maven artifact.

column1: TxMgr/RDX: Remove redundant fetching of the companySalesActivity
column31:
Initially, the companySalesActivity wasn't planned to be part of the cntryInfo type in the RDX.

After our discussions, it has been added to the cntryInfo type. Also, it remains the standalone type in the RDX schema. 

After two rounds of testing, we are sure, that we are getting all the necessary data from the cntryInfo node, and that we can remove companySalesActivity from our query at the product level.  

In our query, it looks like:
 * Product 
 ** prodNo
 ** ...
 **  cntryInfo
 *** companySalesActivity (to remain)
 ** companySalesActivity (to remove)
 ** ...

!image-2024-06-19-10-39-16-722.png|width=572,height=461!

column1: Ensure TxMgr console properties are retained even when restart
column31:
We must ensure that TxMgr console properties are retained even when a restart happens. 

To achieve that, every change in the console must be persisted outside the docker container and initialized from the persistent storage after restart. 

 

*Update:* It's being tested in DEV.

The feature description is on Wiki: [https://wiki.smedigitalapps.com/wiki/display/MI/Transaction+manager%3A+Application+properties+management]

The PR: [https://github.com/SME-AOMA/aoma-transactionmanager/pull/877]

column1: Add NULL check for the TrackMediaKey attribute
column31:
It has been noticed that a few products failed due to "com.sonymusic.gras.jsonbinder.entities.TrackEntity.getTrackMediaKey()" exception. This attribute is defined as NULL in the GRPS. 

The reprocessing lambda function utilizes this attribute in logic to include/exclude tracks from the product tracks list and to determine track type (track, video, work, booklet). Before accessing it, it's necessary to check whether it's NULL or has a value.

column1: AOMA DB instance in PROD for parallel environment
column31:
The parallel TxMgr environment should be started soon to meet the needs of the MI/EOM team and the migration process from Oracle to PostgreSQL. 

Since TxMgr uses tables from the AOMA DB, it's necessary to create a new AOMA DB. It should be a copy of the current production database.

column1: New AOMA DB schema in STAGE
column31:
As we discussed, to test a two-phase commit between the MI PG DB instance and the AOMA DB, it's necessary to have a new AOMA DB instance in STAGE, only for this purpose. 

[https://wiki.smedigitalapps.com/wiki/display/MI/PG+Parallel+testing]

column1: AMEBA PROD Gateway - TxMgr vault service route and user
column31:
Hello [~aomadatadevs], 

We need to add a new route to the AMEBA Prod Gateway:
 * [https://ameba-prod-gw.smcdp-aws.net/txmgr-vault-service/] 

It needs to point to: 
 * "txmgr-vault-service" service, running on "ameba-prod" EKS cluster, "txmgr-prod" namespace, port 8099 (This is already configured in dev and stage)

Localhost example URL: 
{code:java}
http://localhost:8099/vaultSecret/v1?secretName=aomap-aoma-txmgr-user  {code}
Also, we need a new user who has access to this route. The username in dev/stage is: txmgr_app. 

Thanks,
Alem
